channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普在以色列-哈马斯战争问题上批评了拜登总统，但他并没有说他将如何解决冲突，也没有说冲突结束后应该发生什么。
item.description:
Donald Trump has criticized President Biden on the Israel-Hamas war, but he hasn’t said how he would resolve the conflict—or what should happen when it ends https://t.co/6Gy7yQF3Go https://t.co/6Gy7yQF3Go

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）对两家投资顾问公司处以罚款，原因是这两家公司涉嫌在使用人工智能技术方面做出虚假陈述，这也是该委员会对参与所谓 "人工智能洗白 "的企业发出的警告。
item.description:
The Securities and Exchange Commission has fined two investment advisers for allegedly making false statements about their use of artificial-intelligence technology, following through on its warning to go after businesses involved in so-called “AI washing” https://t.co/7KJa6AScSt

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 在美国贫富不均日益加剧的背景下，全国 200 多个城市和郡县正在试行收入保障计划。
item.description:
More than 200 cities and counties around the country are experimenting with guaranteed-income programs amid growing wealth inequality in the U.S. https://t.co/NGRIQtZJyx https://t.co/NGRIQtZJyx

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 当美国和欧洲为基辅的武器问题争论不休时，一个前苏联卫星国正求助于冷战时期的关系，以帮助乌克兰抵御俄罗斯的进攻
item.description:
While the U.S. and Europe argue over weapons for Kyiv, one former Soviet satellite state is turning to Cold War contacts to help Ukraine hold back Russia https://t.co/ZeSCCLQ8BX https://t.co/ZeSCCLQ8BX

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 为了吸引特斯拉，印度降低了某些电动汽车的进口关税，只要制造商在印度投资至少 5 亿美元生产汽车即可。
item.description:
In a step largely aimed at wooing Tesla, India slashed import duties on certain electric vehicles for manufacturers who invest at least $500 million to produce their cars in the country https://t.co/xTcX6HJLdQ https://t.co/xTcX6HJLdQ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰军队疲惫不堪，美国援助停滞不前，乌克兰面临着如何抵御规模更大、装备更精良的俄罗斯军队的问题
item.description:
With its military worn down and U.S. aid stalled, Ukraine confronts how to hold off the larger and better-equipped Russian army https://t.co/54IE5KjpIM https://t.co/54IE5KjpIM

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: "风往哪儿吹，我们就往哪儿去"。没有债务，坐拥巨额存款，DINKs--"双职工，无子女 "夫妇--正在夸耀频繁旅行、财务自由和慷慨赠与的美德。
item.description:
"We go where the wind blows." Free of debt and sitting on hefty savings, DINKs—"dual income, no kids" couples—are boasting the virtues of frequent travel, financial freedom and generous gifting. https://t.co/5zXDMKrpm1 https://t.co/5zXDMKrpm1

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 当西方试图将俄罗斯从其金融体系中分割出去时，莫斯科找到了变通办法。现在，华盛顿堵塞漏洞的努力似乎已见成效。
item.description:
When the West tried to sever Russia from its financial system, Moscow found workarounds. Now, Washington’s efforts to close loopholes appear to be paying off. https://t.co/C98KIl5Fzn https://t.co/C98KIl5Fzn

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 詹姆斯-罗宾逊三世（James D. Robinson III）曾将美国运通打造成金融服务超市，但在 1993 年与公司董事发生高调冲突后离开公司，周一去世，享年 88 岁。
item.description:
James D. Robinson III, who transformed American Express into a financial-services supermarket but left the company in 1993 after a high-profile clash with its directors, died Monday at 88 https://t.co/cAYFjpw0dk https://t.co/cAYFjpw0dk

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 惹怒 NFL。聘请一位 "F "爆主持人把赌注押在流媒体上ESPN 的吉米-皮塔洛（Jimmy Pitaro）正在走出自己的舒适区，以确保这家体育巨头的未来。
item.description:
Ticking off the NFL. Hiring an F-bomb throwing host. Betting the house on streaming. ESPN's Jimmy Pitaro is stretching outside his comfort zone to secure the sports giant's future. https://t.co/QD88T0SVM7 https://t.co/QD88T0SVM7

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 预计到 2024 年，美国的 IT 就业市场将再缩减 20,000 到 30,000 个职位，而人工智能将加速部分技术工作的自动化进程
item.description:
The IT job market in the U.S. is expected to shrink by another 20,000 to 30,000 jobs in 2024, while AI accelerates the automation of some tech jobs https://t.co/ewAT3Zz6Om https://t.co/ewAT3Zz6Om

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 自动售货机似乎不太可能成为 2020 年代投资趋势的候选者，但这一想法却吸引了梦想轻松赚钱的美国人的想象力
item.description:
Vending machines might seem an unlikely candidate for trending investment of the 2020s, but the idea has captured the imagination of Americans dreaming of easier money https://t.co/SQQZ8JKP72 https://t.co/SQQZ8JKP72

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）最资深的高管之一斯蒂芬妮-科恩（Stephanie Cohen）加入了华尔街顶尖女性人才外流的行列。
item.description:
Stephanie Cohen, one of the most senior executives at Goldman Sachs, is joining an exodus of top female talent from the Wall Street firm https://t.co/pGtovefrRr https://t.co/pGtovefrRr

item.title: 航空公司首席执行官迈克尔-奥利里（Michael O'Leary）今年有望获得 1 亿多美元的奖金。F 炸弹、出言不逊的笑话和醉醺醺的晚餐都是他的口头禅。
item.description:
The airline CEO Michael O’Leary is on course for a $100 million-plus bonus this year. F-bombs, off-color jokes and drunken dinners are all part of his lore. https://t.co/soWrf6OVnI https://t.co/soWrf6OVnI

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 一些房地产经纪人预测，变通办法将保护他们的佣金。还有一些人正在退出这个行业。
item.description:
Some real-estate agents predict workarounds will protect their commissions. Others are quitting the industry. https://t.co/WpOOyXdKUv https://t.co/WpOOyXdKUv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 凯拉-雅科夫（Kayla Yaakov）今年 16 岁，驾驶杜卡迪 Panigale V2 参加职业赛车比赛，时速超过 175 英里/小时。她稍后会拿到驾照。
item.description:
Kayla Yaakov is 16 and races professionally on her Ducati Panigale V2 at speeds over 175 mph. She’ll get her driver’s license later. https://t.co/ThNybdGpaa https://t.co/ThNybdGpaa

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 忘掉轮廓分明的腹肌吧。匀称的脚趾间距是健身的新趋势，它和六块腹肌一样难以达到。脚趾间距器来了。
item.description:
Forget well-defined abs. Well-spaced toes are the new fitness flex and can be just as hard to attain as a six pack. Enter the toe spacer. https://t.co/AmaaLuQY8i https://t.co/AmaaLuQY8i

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 为了摆脱多年来因大流行病而造成的与世隔绝的局面，中国正在释放魅力，吸引外国人回国。这比过去更难推销。
item.description:
China is turning on the charm to lure back foreigners, part of an effort to shed years of pandemic-induced isolation that’s sapping its economy. It’s a tougher sell than it used to be. https://t.co/Q6zHnkK9Wt https://t.co/Q6zHnkK9Wt

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 房地产中介佣金是一连串房地产市场动荡中的最新事件。以下是为涉足今年房地产市场的购房者提供的财务游戏计划。

Real-estate agent commissions are the latest in a string of housing-market upheavals. Here’s a financial game plan for home buyers wading into this year’s housing market. https://t.co/9boIKEPOaK https://t.co/9boIKEPOaK

item.title: 自纽约市打击短租以来，纽约市的旅游环境发生了根本性的变化。纽约市 Airbnbs 上列出的短期租房数量从 8 月份的约 21500 套下降到 2 月份的约 3280 套。
item.description:
The travel landscape in New York City has changed fundamentally since its crackdown on short-term rentals. The number of short-term units listed on NYC Airbnbs dropped from about 21,500 in August to about 3,280 in February. https://t.co/PyX9fvCh8R https://t.co/PyX9fvCh8R

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 苹果蜂餐厅价值 1,500 美元的每周用餐稀有通行证已成为厌倦通货膨胀的食客们最热衷的门票之一
item.description:
A rare pass for $1,500 worth of weekly meals at Applebee's has become one of the hottest tickets for inflation-weary diners https://t.co/Wh15dIyP5x https://t.co/Wh15dIyP5x

item.title: 日本央行表示将结束长达八年的负利率试验，这标志着非正统宽松货币政策的广泛转变
item.description:
The Bank of Japan said it would end negative interest rates after an eight-year experiment, symbolizing a broader shift away from unorthodox monetary easing https://t.co/3lslc4PZXm https://t.co/3lslc4PZXm

item.title: 罗伊诉韦德案的判决改变了妇女堕胎的时间、方式和地点，尽管联邦取消了对药物流产的保护，但药物流产变得越来越普遍。
item.description:

item.title: "情况有好有坏。有些东西两天就能卖出去。而另一些东西则一放就是两年"。如何破解纽约令人困惑的高端房地产市场。
